CONCLUSION: Preliminary objections dismissed (locus standi, strike-out request, abuse of the right of application, non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 34;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of a violation sufficient;Costs and expenses (Convention proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , from DATE he served a sentence in GPE correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , Kursk Region ( учреждение ОХ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . On his arrival at the colony , he was called to see the head of the colony , PERSON , who invited him to become a member of a so - called “ секция порядка ” ( literally , an “ order section ” , an informal category of prisoners who cooperated with the prison administration ) and to conclude a written agreement on cooperation with the colony ’s officials . The applicant refused . As a result of his refusal he was beaten by NORP , the deputy head of the correctional colony , PERSON , a colony official , and NORP , head of the security unit . The beating was continued by other colony officials , who stripped him naked and beat him with rubber truncheons . The applicant was then placed for DATE in a disciplinary cell , where the beating continued . On a number of occasions he was beaten in the presence of an official from ORG . The applicant complained about the events to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the institution of criminal proceedings was refused on the ground that “ special equipment ” had been used against the applicant in accordance with the law .

CARDINAL . The applicant claimed to have been systematically beaten for writing complaints against the head of the correctional colony and the colony ’s administration to various authorities , and that he had then been forced to eat the complaints he had written . In particular , on DATE he was beaten with rubber truncheons and thrown to the ground , and an NORP dog was set on him . The dog mostly bit his hands , which he was using to cover his face . According to the applicant , the colony ’s doctor noted the bite marks . He alleged that he still had scars on his hands . The head of the correctional colony then threatened the applicant that if he wrote more complaints he would have to spend TIME in a cell with the dog .

CARDINAL . During TIME DATE the applicant , together with CARDINAL other inmates , PERSON and PERSON , was taken to the office of prison official PERSON , who asked him to report on the situation in the correctional colony . The applicant responded that he was not in control of the situation . As a result of this reply he was beaten and escorted to a cell where , it appeared , other inmates had cut their veins and stomachs . As a protest against the actions of the colony ’s administration , the applicant also cut the veins on his right arm and , having found an electrode in LOC where repair work was being carried out , thrust it in his right side in an attempt to reach the lungs . According to the applicant , after he had inflicted these penetrating wounds on DATE , he was questioned for DATE and it was not until TIME that a physician pulled the electrode from his side ; however , the glass cap remained in his stomach . The surgeon examined the applicant later and noted that a foreign body was still in his stomach , but did not remove it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and other inmates submitted to ORG applications for the institution of criminal proceedings against PERSON , the head of the correctional colony , colony officials NORP and NORP and others , on account of numerous instances of ill - treatment of prisoners . Criminal proceedings in case file no . DATE were instituted against CARDINAL prison officials , NORP and NORP , on account of the alleged beating of inmate PERSON . However , no criminal proceedings were instituted into the applicant ’s allegations as set out in his complaint to ORG , and he was not granted the status of a victim in the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant was held in GPE correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL from DATE to DATE . During this period the applicant repeatedly broke prison rules and on a number of occasions was seen by a psychologist , who diagnosed him as suffering from an emotionally unstable personality disorder .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of a routine search , the applicant was found to have forbidden items , namely CARDINAL metal dowels and CARDINAL razor blades . During the search and seizure of the items the applicant resisted the colony ’s officials . In particular , he pushed them , grabbed their clothes and insulted some of them . CARDINAL of the officials warned him that special equipment could be used against him if he continued behaving in such a way . Since the applicant refused to submit , CARDINAL of the officials used a rubber truncheon against him . After the incident the applicant was examined by a doctor who found abrasions on his back and soft body tissues .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor of GPE was informed of the incident and a report on the use of the special equipment was drafted . The report stated that the rubber truncheon had been used for TIME against soft body tissues . DATE the deputy prosecutor of the Kursk Region personally met the applicant , who told him that he had no complaints against the administration of the correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL and that the application of the special equipment had been justified .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor of the Kursk Region again met the applicant , this time in relation to the injuries he had self - inflicted on DATE while held in a remand prison ( GPE ) in Kursk , prior to his transfer to correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . In a written statement the applicant explained that he had thrust an electrode into his left side in order to attract attention , as he had wanted to be moved to a correctional facility closer to his home . He also stated that he had no complaints against the administration of the remand prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG received the applicant ’s complaint concerning the alleged beating following his arrival at correctional colony LOC .

CARDINAL . In explanations given on DATE , colony officials PERSON , NORP , NORP and PERSON . and the deputy prosecutor of GPE stated that physical force had never been used against the applicant and he had never been threatened with its application .

CARDINAL . Following an inspection , on DATE the prosecutor refused to institute criminal proceedings into the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment . He also found that special measures were lawfully applied against the applicant on DATE . An appeal against that decision lay with a higher prosecutor or a court .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicant had not applied for medical aid in connection with the alleged ill - treatment on DATE . The authorities became aware of these allegations only after the application had been communicated by the ORG .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant sent a complaint to ORG of the Kursk Region . The complaint was received by ORG on DATE . The applicant alleged that since his arrival at correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL he had been regularly beaten by colony officials . He sought to institute criminal proceedings against them .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following an inspection into the applicant ’s allegations , ORG of GPE of Kursk refused to institute criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of Kursk , who was responsible for supervising penitentiary facilities , quashed the decision and remitted the case for additional inspection .

CARDINAL . NORP In the course of the initial and additional inspections the officials who were alleged to have beaten the applicant were questioned by ORG . In particular , the head of the colony , B. , in his statements on DATE and DATE submitted that the inmates , including the applicant , had not been beaten or subjected to degrading treatment and that he had never ordered the use of physical force against them . He regarded the ORG complaints as slanderous and aimed at destabilising the situation in the colony . Similar submissions were made by NORP on DATE and DATE , by NORP on DATE and by PERSON on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE of Kursk again refused to institute criminal proceedings . According to the findings of the inspection , the officials of colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL had not abused their official authority and did not use physical force against the applicant . The use of a rubber truncheon against him on DATE had been justified since he had resisted the officials who had conducted the routine search . An appeal against the decision lay with a higher prosecutor or a court .

CARDINAL . During TIME DATE the applicant self - inflicted a subcutaneous slash wound to his right forearm and subcutaneous slash wounds to the front abdominal wall and inserted a foreign body into the soft tissue of the front abdominal wall . He had no penetrating wounds . At TIME on DATE the applicant was examined by a surgeon of ORG , who removed the foreign body from the applicant ’s abdominal wall and dressed the wounds . The applicant also underwent an X - ray . No foreign bodies , such as a glass cap , remained in the applicant ’s body after he had been provided with medical aid .

CARDINAL . On DATE numerous complaints from inmates of correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL were submitted to ORG of the Kursk Region . The inmates , including the applicant , alleged that they had been systematically beaten by the colony ’s officials . On the same date criminal investigation no . DATE was opened into the allegations of ill - treatment . The applicant was not granted the status of a victim in the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following an inspection , criminal investigation no . DATE was discontinued in the part related to the complaints lodged by the applicant and CARDINAL other inmates , PERSON and PERSON In the course of the inspection ORG examined the relevant medical reports and questioned several officials of the colony , who submitted that no physical force had been applied to the applicant on DATE . ORG of the Kursk Region found that the applicant ’s injuries had been self - inflicted and his allegations of ill - treatment were unsubstantiated . An appeal against the decision lay with a higher prosecutor or a court .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted that on either CARDINAL or DATE he had been escorted to PERSON remand prison GPE ( учреждение ИЗ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL Льгова ) under the guise of transportation to the medical unit . There he was questioned as a witness in relation to the allegedly unlawful actions of the administration of prison OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . In remand prison GPE officials from ORG , including the head of the regional department , ORG , tried to force the applicant to repudiate his statements concerning the allegedly unlawful actions of the administration of correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . They had threatened to institute criminal proceedings against him on charges of disorganising the work of prison institutions . The applicant lodged a complaint against ORG PERSON . was questioned as a witness . Although PERSON . confirmed that PERSON had put pressure on him , trying to force him to repudiate his statements , ORG refused on DATE to institute criminal proceedings against P.

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he was not provided with adequate medical assistance in remand prison GPE . Officials from ORG showed him entries in his medical file stating that he had been examined by a doctor ; however , this was not true . Furthermore , a doctor from the regional hospital at ORG forced him to refuse operative treatment in writing . The doctor explained that ORG did not have sufficient funds for the operation and the applicant did not have enough money to pay for it either .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was allegedly taken out of his cell and placed in a car . He was not informed of either the destination or the purpose of the transportation . In the car he was threatened and insulted by the officials and , unable to bear it any longer , he cut the veins on his right arm . He was then returned to the remand prison . The applicant was not examined by a doctor until lunchtime of DATE , when his wounds were dressed and he was given an analgesic . On DATE several prison officials tortured him , forcing him to refuse Ms Liptser ’s assistance and to withdraw his complaint to the ORG and the statements given in relation to criminal case no . DATE . In particular , they painfully twisted his arms and burnt him with an immersion heater .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant ’s transfer to remand prison GPE was ordered on DATE and on DATE he was escorted there . He remained in the remand prison until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a medical attendant who noted the subcutaneous wounds inflicted by the applicant himself in colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The medical attendant prescribed a dressing with antiseptic ointment . The applicant also stated that he had a foreign body in his stomach . An X - ray conducted on DATE showed no foreign objects in the applicant ’s body . The applicant ’s wounds were dressed DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant committed another act of self - mutilation . At TIME he was examined by a medical attendant who found subcutaneous wounds to the left elbow and the navel area . The wounds were dressed with an antiseptic bandage . DATE the applicant was again seen by the medical assistant , who dressed the wounds with a bandage and antiseptic ointment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s wounds were dressed again . Because of the intumescence on his right forearm the applicant was given antibiotics . On the same date the applicant was examined by the head of the neurosurgical department of the regional hospital at ORG . He stated that the earlier self - inflicted slash wounds to the applicant ’s forearms and the front abdominal wall were infected . The applicant was offered surgical treatment which he refused on DATE in CARDINAL written statements . The refusal was also reflected in his medical file . The X - ray showed no foreign objects in the applicant ’s body .

CARDINAL . In TIME DATE , on the way to the railway station for transportation to another penitentiary facility , the applicant wounded himself in the area of the right elbow joint . Because of the wound the applicant was not allowed to board the train and was returned to remand prison GPE . There he stated that he had self - inflicted the injury . The applicant had damaged the epidermis but the veins in the area of the elbow joint were not affected . His wound was dressed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a surgeon from ORG , who found a subcutaneous wound in the area of the right elbow joint that was not bleeding . The applicant refused to have the wound stitched .

CARDINAL . After the applicant had been transferred to remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , PERSON , he complained to ORG that he had been tortured with an immersion heater while held in remand prison GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings . The decision was quashed by a higher prosecutor and the case remitted for additional inspection .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG again refused to institute criminal proceedings . ORG questioned officers from remand prison GPE and inmates who had been held there at the same time as the applicant . They submitted that they had not seen the applicant being tortured and had not heard of him being ill - treated . The decision noted that on DATE the applicant had not applied for medical aid . However , on DATE he had been examined by a doctor in remand prison GPE , prior to his transportation to remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . No traces of burns had been found in the course of the examination . ORG concluded that the applicant had self - inflicted the injuries . An appeal against the decision lay with a higher prosecutor or a court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was escorted to remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , PERSON ( учреждение ИЗ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL по PERSON области ) .
CARDINAL . On arrival the applicant was examined by a medical attendant , who noted a slash wound in the area of the right elbow joint , scars in the abdominal area and traces of burns on his body .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON visited the applicant in the remand prison . During her visit the applicant made the following statement :

“ In remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL I am also subjected to pressure by officials of ORG from the Kursk and PERSON regions and their colleague from GPE [ ... ] They skilfully beat me without leaving any traces : they beat me on the head with books , on the face with their open palms ... They are about to become residents here DATE they have been dealing with me for DATE now from TIME till TIME . They say that I am the only one remaining . They let me make phone calls to remand prisons in GPE and Kursk , where other convicts tell me to withdraw [ my complaints ] and that they have already withdrawn theirs . [ The officials ] brought letters from others saying that I should withdraw [ the complaints ] , refuse assistance from counsel , that “ this must be done ” . Then they began to beat me again and to burn me with a boiler forcing me to write [ the withdrawal letters ] ... I read [ Sh . ’s ] withdrawal of his application [ before the ORG ] and his rejection of your services ... and a similar withdrawal written by PERSON

“ I was forced [ under torture ] to write dictated statements addressed to PERSON Laptev , representative of ORG before the ORG , Mr PERSON , NORP Ombudsman , ORG and ORG saying that I withdrew everything . These statements are dated DATE and one [ was written ] on DATE but is dated DATE . ”

“ The statements dated CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE should be considered invalid as they are nothing but a result of torture . Only statements written in the presence of my lawyers should be examined .... ”

CARDINAL . The applicant also told his counsel that he had tried to send letters to his lawyers and to submit complaints against the officials who had ill - treated him . However , his complaints had either been returned to him or he had been forced to withdraw them . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s counsel informed ORG of ORG and ORG of the alleged ill - treatment , and on DATE she submitted the same complaints to ORG , asking that criminal proceedings be instituted on account of the use of torture against the applicant . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel also informed the ORG that the applicant had been allegedly forced to write statements on withdrawal of his application to the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor who noted brown streaks on his neck and back . The applicant refused to provide any explanation as to the origin of the injuries to the officials of remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicant had committed another act of self - mutilation .

CARDINAL . In a letter to his counsel dated DATE the applicant reiterated his previous statements concerning the events in correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL and the ill - treatment in remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . He also indicated the names of other prisoners who could confirm his statements .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained about pain in the right side of his stomach . He was examined by a doctor from remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL who suspected that there was a foreign body in the tissues of the front abdominal area . However , the applicant refused to permit palpation of his stomach .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed his counsel that the administration of remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL was aware of the contents of the written statements he had addressed to ORG . Furthermore , he alleged that he had been placed in a disciplinary cell for making statements to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was seen by a surgeon . However , when asked to lie down for an examination , he refused .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor who noted a foreign body in the front abdominal wall . The applicant refused to permit palpation of his stomach . He reiterated the refusal at the examination on DATE . A fluorography conducted on the same date showed a nail measuring QUANTITY in the soft tissues of the abdominal area . On DATE the applicant agreed to have his stomach palpated . During the examination he stated that he could remove the nail himself ; however , he thrust it into a different place . Later that day the applicant was transported to a hospital of ORG . On arrival he refused any medical examination . On DATE the applicant himself removed the nail from the abdominal wall . The doctors dressed his wound with an aseptic bandage .
CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor was called to the applicant ’s cell because he had cut his right forearm in another act of self - mutilation . The wounds were dressed with an aseptic bandage .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was placed in a hospital at correctional facility GPE , GPE , for removal of another foreign body that he had thrust into the abdominal area and for subsequent treatment of the wound .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant arrived at remand prison ORG , ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor ’s Office of the Sovetskiy District of PERSON refused to institute criminal proceedings into the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment in remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The decision was based on the following findings .

CARDINAL . The applicant , who was questioned in the course of the inspection conducted by ORG , submitted that during his placement in remand prison IZ-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ORG agents tortured him with an immersion heater , beat him and forcibly injected drugs into his veins , seeking to force him to withdraw his complaints concerning ORG correctional colony OX-CARDINAL/CARDINAL and the application to the ORG . When he could no longer bear the torture he submitted to the pressure and wrote statements to the ORG , the ombudsman , the prosecutor of GPE and the representative of GPE at the ORG , asking that the proceedings following his previous applications be discontinued .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s cellmate , PERSON , submitted that the applicant had often been taken out of the cell by remand prison officers . He had never complained about ill - treatment on returning to the cell . PERSON had never seen the applicant with any injuries .

CARDINAL . Remand prison officers and officials of ORG submitted that on a number of occasions they “ had had conversations ” with the applicant because he had been under preventive monitoring as a person inclined to absconding , attacking prison officers , taking hostages , self - mutilation and suicide . However , they had never applied either psychological or physical pressure to the applicant and he had never made any complaints in this regard during the conversations .
CARDINAL . The inventory of personal items which the applicant had had with him in the remand prison included an immersion heater .

CARDINAL . The medical attendant who examined the applicant on DATE submitted that the applicant had explained that the injuries found had been caused by a dog and by officials from ORG for the Execution of Sentences , who had burned him with an immersion heater . He also noted that the burn marks had been located in places where the applicant could have inflicted them himself .

CARDINAL . The doctor who examined the applicant on DATE submitted that he could not be sure that the injuries found had been burn marks . Furthermore , the applicant had refused to provide any explanation as to their origin .

CARDINAL . The head of ORG submitted that on the basis of the available medical documents and the applicant ’s medical file it was not possible to come to any conclusions with regard to the nature of the applicant ’s injuries , if any .

CARDINAL . The Prosecutor ’s Office concluded that the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment were unsubstantiated and the injuries found had been caused by the applicant himself . An appeal against the decision lay with a higher prosecutor or a court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government sent the ORG a copy of a statement dated CARDINAL DATE , addressed to ORG at the ORG , Mr GPE , and written and signed by the applicant . The statement read as follows :

“ I ask you to examine and accept the statement written in my own hand that I , PERSON , ask you , Mr P.A. Laptev , to recall from ORG the application that I lodged through my counsel PERSON . I do not want it [ the application ] to be examined in the present proceedings . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was transferred to correctional colony no . CARDINAL , GPE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure of DATE provides for judicial review of decisions by investigators and prosecutors that might infringe the constitutional rights of participants in proceedings or prevent access to a court .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , as amended on DATE , provides that all incoming and outgoing correspondence of detainees is subject to censorship by the administration of the correctional facility . Correspondence with courts , prosecutors , penitentiary officials , the ORG , the public monitoring board and the ORG is not subject to censorship . Correspondence of convicted persons with their counsel is not subject to censorship unless the administration of the correctional facility has reliable information to the effect that it is aimed at initiating , planning or organising a crime or involving other people in the commission of a crime . In this case the correspondence is subject to control on the basis of a reasoned decision by the head of the correctional facility or his deputy .

DATE . Rule CARDINAL of LAW adopted by Decree no . CARDINAL of ORG of DATE and amended on DATE , DATE and DATE , provided that letters from detainees should be placed in mail boxes in the facilities or handed over to representatives of the administration in unsealed envelopes . The regulations were repealed by Decree no . CARDINAL of ORG of DATE , which adopted new regulations . Rule CARDINAL of the new regulations provides that letters from detainees should be placed in mail boxes in the facilities or handed over to representatives of the administration in unsealed envelopes , except for correspondence which is not subject to censorship ( that is , with the organisations and persons listed in ORG paragraph CARDINAL ) .
